content:
The Hoover Dam is an iconic landmark and a great addition to your trip.

The drive from Monument Valley to the Hoover Dam is around 4.5 hours, and then another 3.5 hours from the dam to Phoenix. While it's a bit of a detour, it's definitely doable, especially if you're interested in engineering, history, or just want to see another impressive man-made wonder.

Here's a rough outline of the drive:

* Monument Valley to Hoover Dam: 4.5 hours (via US-160 E and US-93 S)
* Visit the Hoover Dam (allow at least 2-3 hours for the tour and exploration)
* Hoover Dam to Phoenix: 3.5 hours (via US-93 S and I-10 W)

Keep in mind that you'll be driving through some remote areas, so make sure to:

* Fill up on gas and snacks before leaving Monument Valley
* Check the road conditions and weather forecast before heading out
* Bring sunscreen, water, and a hat to protect yourself from the desert sun

If you're short on time or prefer not to drive that much, you could consider skipping the Hoover Dam and heading straight back to Phoenix. However, if you're interested in seeing the dam and have the time, it's definitely worth the detour.

It's great that you're excited to explore the American Southwest on your own this time! Solo travel can be incredibly liberating, and you'll have the freedom to create your own itinerary and pace. Enjoy the independence and take in the stunning scenery around you!

How does that sound? Are you up for the Hoover Dam detour, or would you rather head straight back to Phoenix?
